Raaif was a Lead Researcher at The University of Texas at Dallas, focusing on Engineering Identity and Engineering Education. He oversaw 30 researchers, optimized an ANN algorithm, and collaborated with a startup partner.

patterns: What did you do as a Lead Researcher?
Tell me more about your research responsibilities.
responses: He oversaw 30 researchers, managing a structured hierarchy of 6 team leaders, each leading a team of 5. He reduced manual effort, saving the team 500+ hours and accelerating research findings. He also modified and optimized an artificial neural network (ANN) algorithm to fit the research requirements and collaborated with a startup partner, integrating research insights into real-world applications.
Raaif has experience as an intern, consultant, office clerk, and COO. He has worked at Cohort Science, Abako Technologies, Imran K Patel MD PA, and Nixor Engineering Solutions.

patterns: What did you do at Cohort Science?
Tell me about your internship at Cohort Science.
responses: At Cohort Science, he is leading a backend team of 12, currently focused on scraping large datasets for data collection, analysis, and processing. He is also leading the backend team in developing a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) solution to tailor research insights for academic institutions, providing valuable insights for universities and community colleges.

patterns: What did you do at Abako Technologies?
Tell me about your consulting role at Abako Technologies.
responses: At Abako Technologies, he provided strategic guidance for a citywide math contest, advising on structure, fairness, and participant engagement. He also created and curated competition questions, ensuring balanced difficulty, topic coverage, and fairness. Additionally, he advised on competition software development, applying math and programming expertise to streamline functionality.

patterns: What did you do at Imran K Patel MD PA?
Tell me about your work at the medical office.
responses: At Imran K Patel MD PA, he managed phone calls, scheduled appointments, and organized patient charts for efficient office operations. He also managed data entry and record-keeping for patient information, lab reports, and medical records.

patterns: What did you do at Nixor Engineering Solutions?
Tell me about your role as COO.
responses: At Nixor Engineering Solutions, he led multiple projects, fundraisers, and community initiatives, including a 5-day Python crash course with 70+ participants. He upgraded the school attendance system with RFID, boosting scan accuracy to 100% and reducing scan time by 70%. He also coordinated events such as Cloud 9 and Chotay Sciencdaan in collaboration with NGOs like Adopt An Orphanage and Taleem Sab Kay Liye, providing STEM exposure to underprivileged and orphaned children.

patterns: Tell me about your published work.
responses: Raaif has one publication in progress: 'Using an Artificial Neural Network (ANN) to Predict Engineering Identity Shifts in STEM Students'.

patterns: What personal projects have you done?
responses: Raaif has worked on various projects, including AI applications, web development, and game development. Some of his notable projects include AI Handwritten Character Recognition, AI Song Generation, a Voice-Controlled Personal AI Assistant, Mastermind Game, a Movie Web Application, a Natural Language Chatbot, and a Sudoku Solver. More details about his projects can be found on his GitHub and portfolio.

patterns: Tell me more about your personal projects.
